ie.gmit

Class Encoding

  • java.lang.Object
    • ie.gmit.FileReaderWriter
      • ie.gmit.Encoding

  • public class Encoding
extends FileReaderWriter
    Author:
    Pawel This Class provides Base64, Base32, Hex and RunLength encoding. It uses external libraries such as apache commons and JSoup to get extra functionality. This class also extends FileReaderWriter class to provide text manipulation as well as few extra input/output methods.

      • Base64Encoded

        public static byte[] Base64Encoded(String plainText)
        Encodes binary data using Base64 algorithm.
        Parameters:
        plainText - tring text that will be converted to bytes and encoded
        Returns:
        byte[] containing Base64 characters in their UTF-8 representation.

      • Base64Decoded

        public static byte[] Base64Decoded(String encodedText)
        Decodes Base64 data into octets.
        Parameters:
        encodedText - String containing Base64 data
        Returns:
        byte[] containing decoded data.

      • HexEncoded

        public static char[] HexEncoded(String plainText)
                         throws Exception
        Converts an array of bytes into an array of characters representing the hexadecimal values of each byte in order. The returned array will be double the length of the passed array, as it takes two characters to represent any given byte.
        Parameters:
        plainText - String to convert to hex characters
        Returns:
        A char[] containing hexadecimal characters
        Throws:
        Exception

      • HexDecoded

        public static byte[] HexDecoded(String encodedText)
                         throws Exception
        Converts an String of characters representing hexadecimal values into an array of bytes of those same values. The returned array will be half the length of the passed array, as it takes two characters to represent any given byte.
        Parameters:
        encodedText - A String of characters containing hexadecimal digits
        Returns:
        A byte array containing binary data decoded from the supplied char array.
        Throws:
        Exception - An exception is thrown if the passed char array has an odd number of elements.

      • Base32Encoded

        public static byte[] Base32Encoded(String plainText)
        Encodes a String containing binary data, into a byte[] containing characters in the alphabet.
        Parameters:
        plainText - A String containing binary data.
        Returns:
        A byte array containing only the basen alphabetic character data.

      • Base32Decoded

        public static byte[] Base32Decoded(String encodedText)
        Decodes a String containing characters in the Base32 alphabet.
        Parameters:
        encodedText - A String containing Base32 character data.
        Returns:
        A byte[] containing binary data.

      • RunLengthEncoded

        public static String RunLengthEncoded(String text,
                      File outputFile)
                               throws Exception
        Encodes a String of repetitive alphabet characters to decrease the size of a file.
        Parameters:
        text - A String of repetitive alphabet characters.
        outputFile - File object in which the encoded String will be stored.
        Returns:
        Encoded String of characters and digits that show how many occurrences of a certain character there was.
        Throws:
        Exception - Throws exception if there were any digits in text.

      • RunLengthDecoded

        public static String RunLengthDecoded(String text,
                      File outputFile)
                               throws Exception
        Decodes a String using RunLength algorithm.
        Parameters:
        text - String of encoded characters.
        outputFile - File object in which the decoded String will be stored.
        Returns:
        Decoded String of characters.
        Throws:
        Exception
